item.description:

item.title: Constant fly tipping continues - all over road and pavement, 20th August
item.description:
This corner of our road is used constantly by people to fly tip. This week it’s a wooden cabinet broken with pieces flung all across the pavement, road, and our communal bin area. It’s a council problem to sort. INSTALL CCTV and PROSECUTE fly tippers.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Monteagle Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over a year old dumped and now decomposed waste next to a low wall of a semi-detached house and on a public path, 20th August
item.description:
Multiple bags of what appears to be rubble and garden waste, have been there for more than 12 months. The bags have decomposed, and weeds have now grown from it. Broken and discarded building materials, plant pots, glass bottles, plastic bottles (with questionable liquids), toys and black bags with dog foul, obviously becoming a dumping area. The waste is attracting unwanted pests such as blue bottle flies and foxes. Loose rubble, stones and chippings are constantly cascaded across the pavement and into the road, making it a trip hazard and a nuisance for vehicle and bike tyres. The waste is immediately next to a house on Moordown SE18 3NA, a semi-detached house, with a public path alongside it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moordown, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
